headline: The Secret Script That Stole Democracy
lede: At the direction of WVDP leadership, seventy-five percent of West Virginia's minority communities were locked out before the meeting even started. A secret script, authored by the party's own compliance officer, dictated every vote and guaranteed a pre-determined outcome. What was supposed to be an open process to empower minority voices became a choreographed takeover that excluded the very people it claimed to serve.

violations.title: The Exclusion: 75% of Minority Groups Were Denied Representation
violations.keyEvidence: The formation script admitted the committee was 'missing... Latino's, Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders, and Native Americans' yet proceeded with the illegal formation anyway.
violations.summary: The 2020 DNC agreement mandated a simple sequence: form caucuses, then let them choose representatives. Selina Vickers and the WVDP flipped it. They formed the committee first, appointed the leaders, then promised to maybe create caucuses later. This meant Latino, Asian American, Pacific Islander, and Native American Democrats had zero voice in their own representation.
evidencePoints: Only one of the four required racial caucuses had been formed before the committee was created.
Three of four required minority communities were excluded from the process.
The formation script itself admitted the process was 'missing... representation' from three key communities.
Leadership proceeded with the formation despite the acknowledged lack of representation.

proofs.title: The Foundational Breach of the DNC MOU
The Failure to Implement the Diversity Plan

violations.consequence: Three entire racial communities were denied any say in who would represent them. Their 'representation' was assigned to them by the very people who excluded them from the process.

violations.title: The Script: The Compliance Officer Wrote Herself Into Power
violations.keyEvidence: A formation script marked 'DRAFT SCRIPT - do not share' dictated every nomination, including Vickers nominating herself as Parliamentarian.
violations.summary: Selina Vickers wasn't just the MOU compliance officer—she was the puppet master. She wrote a detailed script that controlled every aspect of the meeting: who would speak, what they'd say, who they'd nominate. Most audaciously, she scripted her own appointment to Parliamentarian, complete with pre-written praise calling her 'uniquely qualified.'
evidencePoints: A script marked 'DRAFT SCRIPT - do not share' proves consciousness of wrongdoing.
The script dictated that 'Mary Ann nominates Hollis Lewis.'
The script instructed Vickers to nominate herself for Parliamentarian.
It included a pre-written endorsement calling her 'no one else remotely qualified.'
As Parliamentarian, Vickers controlled procedures, interpretations, and the official records.
violations.consequence: The person charged with ensuring a fair process instead rigged it for her own power. Every 'vote' was theater. Democracy was replaced with a script.

violations.title: The Ringer: An Undisclosed Conflict of Interest Corrupted the Process
violations.keyEvidence: When democracy blocked their agenda, they brought in PDPR founder Larry Taylor—without disclosing he was Vickers' political partner who trains activists to 'beat the establishment.'
violations.summary: People for Democratic Party Reform (PDPR) teaches how to 'use rules, procedures and bylaws to beat the establishment at their own game.' Their WV Chair? Selina Vickers. Their founder? Larry Taylor. When the committee democratically rejected restrictive rules, Vickers brought in Taylor to 'preside' over forcing them through—without telling members about their PDPR connection.
evidencePoints: In August, the committee democratically rejected restrictive rules proposed by leadership.
In September, Larry Taylor was brought in to preside over the next meeting as an 'impartial' expert.
Leadership failed to disclose Taylor's role as the founder of PDPR.
Leadership failed to disclose Vickers' role as PDPR's West Virginia Chair.
Leadership failed to disclose their partnership in training activists on procedural manipulation.
Under Taylor's direction, the previously rejected rules were forced through.

proofs.title: Undisclosed Conflict of Interest Corrupted Committee Process

violations.consequence: Democracy was overruled by deception. Members thought they were getting a neutral referee. They got Vickers' business partner executing their shared playbook.

conclusion.headline: They Knew. They Planned. They Executed.
conclusion.summary: This wasn't incompetence—it was a conspiracy that demonstrated a clear consciousness of guilt. The script proves premeditation. The PDPR connection proves methodology. Selina Vickers orchestrated a hostile takeover of West Virginia's diversity initiative, turning minority empowerment into minority exclusion. The committee born from this fraudulent process lacks any legitimate authority.

headline: A Systematic Campaign to Crush Minority Dissent
lede: When elected Indigenous and Black caucus leaders realized they'd been played, they spoke up. What followed was a systematic campaign of destruction: A DNC official advised leadership on how to neutralize them. Vickers orchestrated smear campaigns. Their votes were nullified. They were branded 'dangerous.' This is how the Democratic Party systematically dismantled its own minority leaders who dared dissent.

violations.title: The DNC's Betrayal: A Supervisor Advised Suppression
violations.keyEvidence: While his duty was to ensure fairness, DNC Rules Committee member Harold Ickes instead advised party leadership on how to 'outvote' and neutralize the very minority leaders he was supposed to be supervising.
violations.summary: Harold Ickes wasn't just any DNC official—he sat on the Rules & Bylaws Committee supervising this process. His job was ensuring fairness. Instead, he coached Selina Vickers, a non-voting parliamentarian, on how to 'outvote' the elected Indigenous and Black caucus chairs. The supervisor became the saboteur.
evidencePoints: Harold Ickes was the DNC Rules & Bylaws Committee member assigned to this process.
His official role was to provide 'supervision and technical assistance.'
His actual advice to leadership was to 'outvote' the elected minority leaders.
The targets of this advice were the duly-elected chairs of the Indigenous and Black caucuses.
The DNC's designated supervisor actively corrupted the process he was assigned to protect.

proofs.title: DNC Official Violated MOU by Advising Dissent Suppression

violations.consequence: The DNC didn't just fail to protect minority voices—it actively conspired to silence them. Trust in the national party's commitment to diversity was shattered.

violations.title: The Smear Campaign: Dissenters Were Branded 'Dangerous'
violations.keyEvidence: A secret script and a vicious rumor: Vickers orchestrated attacks, instructing allies 'DO NOT FORWARD THIS EMAIL' while spreading rumors that a dissenter was 'dangerous.'
violations.summary: When procedural tricks weren't enough, they got personal. Vickers secretly wrote attack scripts for others to use, hiding her authorship. She spread what the Indigenous Caucus chair called 'a vicious rumor that I am dangerous.' A coordinated social media campaign branded dissenters as 'toxic bullies and saboteurs.' This wasn't politics—it was character assassination.
evidencePoints: Vickers secretly authored attack scripts, instructing allies 'DO NOT FORWARD THIS EMAIL.'
She concealed her authorship while orchestrating the attacks against dissenters.
She spread a vicious rumor that a dissenting minority leader was 'dangerous.'
A coordinated social media campaign branded dissenters as 'toxic bullies and saboteurs.'
Elected minority caucus leaders were targeted with multi-day public harassment.
violations.consequence: Elected minority leaders were personally destroyed for defending their communities' rights. The message to others was clear: speak up and we'll ruin you.

violations.title: The Procedural Weapon: Democratic Votes Were Nullified
violations.keyEvidence: After the committee voted for inclusive subcommittees, leadership declared 'by appointment only' and excluded Indigenous and Black chairs.
violations.summary: The PDPR playbook's ultimate weapon: when you lose a vote, declare it void. The committee democratically chose volunteer-based subcommittees. Leadership simply announced it would be 'by appointment' instead. They then denied seats to the Indigenous and Black caucus chairs. When caught mislabeling bylaws to avoid notice requirements, they brought in their PDPR colleague to ram them through anyway.
evidencePoints: The committee voted democratically for volunteer-based subcommittees.
Leadership unilaterally overrode the vote, declaring subcommittees would be 'by appointment only.'
They subsequently denied appointments to the Indigenous and Black Caucus chairs.
Bylaws were intentionally mislabeled as 'procedural rules' to evade the 30-day notice requirement.
When a member exposed the scheme, PDPR founder Larry Taylor was brought in to force the adoption.
The WVDP's own Appeals Board later ruled the entire meeting and its outcomes were invalid.

proofs.title: Leadership Nullifies Vote to Exclude Caucuses
The PDPR Playbook and the Bylaw Mislabeling Scheme

violations.consequence: Democracy became meaningless. Votes only counted if leadership won. The two minority leaders who fought back were systematically stripped of any power to effect change.

conclusion.headline: A Masterclass in Minority Suppression
conclusion.summary: This wasn't random retaliation—it was systematic suppression following the PDPR playbook. Corrupt their process. Destroy their character. Strip their power. The Indigenous and Black leaders who stood up for their communities were crushed as examples to others. Harold Ickes provided the strategy. Selina Vickers executed it. The Democratic Party enabled it. The minority communities of West Virginia were left with no authentic representation, only appointed puppets.

headline: Forged Signatures & Hidden Money
lede: When the treasurer of A New Day PAC resigned over 'ethical concerns,' someone kept filing reports with her signature anyway. When the PAC ran a scholarship program, they reported zero dollars spent. These aren't accounting errors—they're crimes. And the trail leads back to the same network that corrupted the AAC.

violations.title: The Forgery: PAC Reports Were Filed with a Forged Signature
violations.keyEvidence: Kim Felix resigned as treasurer. Reports filed after her resignation bore her signature. Felix confirmed in a sworn statement: 'I did not sign these.'
violations.summary: Kim Felix saw something that made her resign as PAC treasurer, citing 'ethical concerns.' But her resignation created a problem—PACs need a treasurer's signature to file reports. Their solution? Forge it. Multiple sworn financial documents filed with the state bore Felix's signature after she'd walked away. She confirmed in a witness statement: she never signed them. Someone committed forgery on official state documents.
evidencePoints: Treasurer Kim Felix resigned from the PAC, citing 'ethical concerns.'
Financial reports filed *after* her resignation continued to bear her signature.
Felix provided a sworn statement confirming: 'I did not sign these reports.'
Under state law, only the treasurer can legally sign and submit these sworn financial documents.
Filing a false sworn statement is a criminal offense under WV Code §3-8-5.
violations.consequence: Someone committed criminal forgery to hide what made the treasurer flee. The public was deceived. The state was defrauded. And whoever signed Felix's name committed a felony.

violations.title: The Black Hole: An Unreported Scholarship Program Concealed Transactions
violations.keyEvidence: August 22, 2023: PAC advertises scholarships. Q3 2023 report: Zero dollars reported.
violations.summary: Political money has one sacred rule: every dollar must be tracked. A New Day PAC brazenly violated it. They publicly solicited scholarship applications for training programs. But when their Q3 2023 financial report came due, they reported exactly zero dollars in expenditures and zero in-kind contributions. The scholarships existed—the money vanished. This is how dark money works.
evidencePoints: On August 22, 2023, the PAC publicly solicited applications for a scholarship program.
Fact: The scholarship provided political training from PDPR, a paid consultant.
Fact: The PAC's official Q3 2023 financial report lists $0.00 in expenditures.
Fact: The report also lists $0.00 in in-kind contributions for the same period.
Conclusion: The PAC illegally concealed the source and destination of funds for its scholarship program, leaving the public in the dark.
violations.consequence: Campaign finance laws exist to prevent corruption by requiring transparency. This PAC operated a black box—money in, money out, no trace. The public cannot track who funded this political training or who received it. Democracy requires daylight. This PAC chose darkness.

conclusion.headline: The Money Always Tells The Truth
conclusion.summary: Follow the money and you find the truth. A treasurer flees over 'ethics.' Her signature gets forged. A scholarship program operates in shadow. Zero dollars reported. This isn't sloppy bookkeeping—it's deliberate concealment. The same network that stole democracy from West Virginia's minorities (PDPR) was being paid by a PAC that forged documents and hid transactions. The corruption wasn't just procedural. It was financial. It was criminal. And they thought they'd never get caught.
